title: Oxygen Sensors

body.body: - the left hand primary oxygen sensor is situated in the exhaust header pipe system close to the cylinder head. The oxygen sensor constantly feed information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. Based on this information, adjustments to air/fuel ratio are made.

- the right hand primary oxygen sensor is situated in the exhaust header pipe system close to the cylinder head. The oxygen sensor constantly feed information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. Based on this information, adjustments to air/fuel ratio are made.

- situated in the exhaust header pipe system upstream of the catalyst. The oxygen sensor constantly feeds information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. Based on this information, adjustments to the air/fuel ratio are made.

- situated in the exhaust header pipe system upstream of the catalyst. The oxygen sensor constantly relays information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. When the data is viewed the voltage signal will oscillate rapidly, indicating the engine control module is making rapid adjustments to the air/fuel ratio.

- situated in the exhaust header pipe system upstream of the catalyst. The oxygen sensor constantly relays information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. When the data is viewed the voltage signal will oscillate rapidly, indicating the engine control module is making rapid adjustments to the air/fuel ratio.

- situated downstream (after) the catalyst. The oxygen sensor monitors and provides information to the engine ECM. When the data is viewed the voltage signal should move very slowly in its range indicating the catalytic converter is successfully reducing the amount of HC’s (hydrocarbons) emitted from the exhaust.

- the right hand primary oxygen sensor is situated in the exhaust header pipe system close to the cylinder head. The oxygen sensor constantly feed information to the engine ECM on the content of the exhaust gases. Based on this information, adjustments to air/fuel ratio are made.

- situated downstream (after) the catalyst. The oxygen sensor monitors and provides information to the engine ECM. When the data is viewed the voltage signal should move very slowly in its range indicating the catalytic converter is successfully reducing the amount of HC’s (hydrocarbons) emitted from the exhaust.
